main event: An unidentified ch4 object was sighted by ground-radar near Baker, Oregon on July 16, 1963, and described as stationary while gaining altitude.
interesting points: The object was monitored for 5 minutes and appeared to gain altitude to 18,000 feet., Air control indicated there were no aircraft in the area, and it was determined that it was not a balloon., A T-33 pilot reported seeing a disc-shaped object measuring 30-40 feet in diameter from 18,000 feet., The object's color was described as dark brownish-red with rounded corners., Major Sherrell, who observed the object, stated he has seen many balloons and believed this sighting was not one.
witness description: Major Sherrell, pilot of a T-33, and 1st Lt. Fox, co-pilot
